newsitem.title: USA: Meridian wins FDA OK for cardiac monitor.
newsitem.headline: Meridian wins FDA OK for cardiac monitor.

text.p: Meridian Medical Technologies Inc said Friday it has received clearance from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration to market its CardioBeeper CB-12L cardiac monitor.
The CardioBeeper CB-12L monitor, said the company will be marketed to cardiac monitoring service centers, physicians, group practices, hospitals and pharmaceutical cardiac drug study programs.

The CardioBeeper CB-12L monitor allows the patient to transmit a 12-lead ECG, providing medical personnel with comprehensive cardiac electrical data from home or office within 45 seconds, said Meridian. It is primarily designed for monitoring patients who have cardiac-related symptoms such as chest pain or irregular heartbeats.
The company said it expects the market for the device to be "significant" among U.S. physicians and their patients.
The CardioBeeper CB-12L monitor has previously received regulatory approval in Europe and is currently marketed outside the United States.
